creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two women in kimono, one holding an umbrella cross over a double arched stone bridge; pond with blossoming lily pads in foreground; large willow tree in middle ground at L; white building with willow tree in middle ground at R
marks: left, cursive jizuri: 自摺　大正拾五年作　柳に石橋 {jizuri, Tais LLC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Willow and Stone Bridge
